name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A novel by J.D. Salinger about the disillusionment of a teenager.
author: J.D. Salinger

name: Moby-Dick
description: A novel by Herman Melville about the journey of the whaling ship Pequod.
author: Herman Melville

name: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

name: Frankenstein
description: A novel by Mary Shelley depicting the story of Victor Frankenstein and his creature.
author: Mary Shelley

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: A trilogy by J.R.R. Tolkien following the quest to destroy the One Ring.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel by Harper Lee set in the 1930s Southern United States.
author: Harper Lee

description: A dystopian novel by George Orwell depicting a totalitarian regime.
author: George Orwell

name: Brave New World
description: A novel by Aldous Huxley depicting a futuristic society.
author: Aldous Huxley

name: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald about the American Dream and the Roaring Twenties.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

name: Crime and Punishment
description: A novel by Fyodor Dostoevsky exploring the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of the protagonist.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: A novel by Gabriel García Márquez depicting the Buendía family's seven generations in the town of Macondo.
author: Gabriel García Márquez

name: Wuthering Heights
description: A novel by Emily Brontë depicting the passionate, if doomed, love between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.
author: Emily Brontë

name: The Odyssey
description: An epic poem by Homer depicting the journey of Odysseus after the fall of Troy.
author: Homer

name: Jane Eyre
description: A novel by Charlotte Brontë following the experiences of its eponymous heroine.
author: Charlotte Brontë

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A novel by Oscar Wilde about a young man who sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty.
author: Oscar Wilde

name: War and Peace
description: A novel by Leo Tolstoy depicting the French invasion of Russia and its impact on society.
author: Leo Tolstoy

name: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: A novel by Mark Twain about the journey of a boy and a runaway slave down the Mississippi River.
author: Mark Twain

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A novel by Jane Austen about the manners and marriage in the British Regency period.
author: Jane Austen

name: Great Expectations
description: A novel by Charles Dickens following the life and education of an orphan named Pip.
author: Charles Dickens

name: The Brothers Karamazov
description: A novel by Fyodor Dostoevsky about the murder of their father and the conflicts between three brothers.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

name: Anna Karenina
description: A novel by Leo Tolstoy depicting the tragedy of a married aristocrat and her affair with the affluent Count Vronsky.
author: Leo Tolstoy

name: The Count of Monte Cristo
description: A novel by Alexandre Dumas following the journey of Edmond Dantès seeking revenge.
author: Alexandre Dumas

name: Les Misérables
description: A novel by Victor Hugo depicting the lives of several characters, particularly ex-convict Jean Valjean.
author: Victor Hugo

name: The Grapes of Wrath
description: A novel by John Steinbeck following the Joad family's migration during the Great Depression.
author: John Steinbeck

name: Don Quixote
description: A novel by Miguel de Cervantes following the adventures of Alonso Quixano, who reads so many chivalric romances that he loses his sanity.
author: Miguel de Cervantes

name: The Scarlet Letter
description: A novel by Nathaniel Hawthorne set in 17th-century Puritan Massachusetts Bay Colony.
author: Nathaniel Hawthorne

name: Alice's Adventures in Wonderland
description: A novel by Lewis Carroll following a girl named Alice who falls through a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar creatures.
author: Lewis Carroll

name: The Iliad
description: An ancient Greek epic poem by Homer about the Trojan War.
author: Homer

name: The Divine Comedy
description: An epic poem by Dante Alighieri depicting the journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.
author: Dante Alighieri

name: The Sun Also Rises
description: A novel by Ernest Hemingway following a group of American and British expatriates who travel from Paris to the Festival of San Fermín in Pamplona to watch the running of the bulls and the bullfights.
author: Ernest Hemingway

name: The Old Man and the Sea
description: A novella by Ernest Hemingway about an aging Cuban fisherman named Santiago who struggles with a giant marlin far out in the Gulf Stream.
author: Ernest Hemingway

name: The Bell Jar
description: A novel by Sylvia Plath about a young woman who descends into mental illness.
author: Sylvia Plath

name: The Canterbury Tales
description: A collection of stories by Geoffrey Chaucer about a group of pilgrims traveling to the shrine of Thomas Becket in Canterbury Cathedral.
author: Geoffrey Chaucer

name: The Stranger
description: A novel by Albert Camus following Meursault, an emotionally detached French Algerian who refuses to conform to societal expectations.
author: Albert Camus

name: The Road
description: A novel by Cormac McCarthy following a father and his young son over a period of several months across a landscape blasted by an unspecified cataclysm that has destroyed most of civilization and, in the intervening years, almost all life on Earth.
author: Cormac McCarthy

name: The Color Purple
description: A novel by Alice Walker about the lives of African American women in the southern United States in the 1930s.
author: Alice Walker

name: Heart of Darkness
description: A novella by Joseph Conrad about a voyage up the Congo River into the Congo Free State in the Heart of Africa.
author: Joseph Conrad

name: Slaughterhouse-Five
description: A novel by Kurt Vonnegut about the experiences of Billy Pilgrim, a soldier who becomes unstuck in time.
author: Kurt Vonnegut

name: Middlemarch
description: A novel by George Eliot following the lives of the residents of the fictional Midlands town of Middlemarch.
author: George Eliot

name: The Handmaid's Tale
description: A dystopian novel by Margaret Atwood set in the near future, in a totalitarian theocracy that has overthrown the United States government.
author: Margaret Atwood

name: Moby-Dick
description: A novel by Herman Melville about the obsessive quest of Ahab, captain of the whaling ship Pequod, for revenge on the giant white sperm whale Moby Dick.
author: Herman Melville

name: Emma
description: A novel by Jane Austen about the perils of misconstrued romance.
author: Jane Austen

name: Madame Bovary
description: A novel by Gustave Flaubert about the life of Emma Bovary and her affairs with Rodolphe Boulanger and Léon Dupuis.
author: Gustave Flaubert

name: War and Peace
description: A novel by Leo Tolstoy set against the backdrop of the Napoleonic Wars.
author: Leo Tolstoy

name: The Picture of Dorian Gray
description: A novel by Oscar Wilde about Dorian Gray, a young man who sells his soul for eternal youth and beauty.
author: Oscar Wilde

name: Wuthering Heights
description: A novel by Emily Brontë about the passionate and destructive love between Heathcliff and Catherine Earnshaw.
author: Emily Brontë

name: Gone with the Wind
description: A novel by Margaret Mitchell set in the American South during the Civil War and Reconstruction era.
author: Margaret Mitchell

name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
description: A novel by Gabriel García Márquez following the Buendía family through seven generations in the town of Macondo.
author: Gabriel García Márquez

name: The Catcher in the Rye
description: A novel by J.D. Salinger following Holden Caulfield, a young man in New York City, who feels alienated from the world.
author: J.D. Salinger

name: The Trial
description: A novel by Franz Kafka following Josef K., a man arrested and prosecuted by a remote, inaccessible authority, with the nature of his crime revealed neither to him nor to the reader.
author: Franz Kafka

name: To Kill a Mockingbird
description: A novel by Harper Lee set in the American South during the 1930s, addressing issues of racism and injustice.
author: Harper Lee

name: The Hobbit
description: A fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien following the journey of Bilbo Baggins, who is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

name: The Great Gatsby
description: A novel by F. Scott Fitzgerald set in the Jazz Age on Long Island, following the mysterious millionaire Jay Gatsby and his obsession with the beautiful Daisy Buchanan.
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

description: A dystopian novel by George Orwell set in a totalitarian regime, where the government controls every aspect of life.
author: George Orwell

name: Frankenstein
description: A novel by Mary Shelley about Victor Frankenstein, who creates a creature in an unorthodox scientific experiment.
author: Mary Shelley

name: The Odyssey
description: An ancient Greek epic poem by Homer following the Greek hero Odysseus on his journey home from the Trojan War.
author: Homer

name: Crime and Punishment
description: A novel by Fyodor Dostoevsky following the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of Rodion Raskolnikov, an impoverished ex-student in Saint Petersburg who formulates a plan to kill an unscrupulous pawnbroker for her money.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

name: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
description: A novel by Mark Twain following the adventures of Huck Finn and his friend Tom Sawyer as they travel down the Mississippi River.
author: Mark Twain

name: The Fountainhead
description: A novel by Ayn Rand about an individualistic young architect named Howard Roark and his struggles against conventional standards.
author: Ayn Rand

name: Catch-22
description: A novel by Joseph Heller set during World War II, following Captain John Yossarian, a U.S. Army Air Forces B-25 bombardier.
author: Joseph Heller

name: Pride and Prejudice
description: A novel by Jane Austen about the romantic adventures of Elizabeth Bennet and her four sisters after two rich and eligible bachelors move into their neighborhood.
author: Jane Austen

name: The Brothers Karamazov
description: A novel by Fyodor Dostoevsky following the murder of Fyodor Pavlovich Karamazov, an immoral father of four sons, each with a distinct personality.
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky

name: Anna Karenina
description: A novel by Leo Tolstoy following the tragic love affair between Anna Karenina and Count Alexei Vronsky.
author: Leo Tolstoy

name: Ulysses
description: A novel by James Joyce that chronicles the peripatetic appointments and encounters of Leopold Bloom in Dublin on June 16, 1904.
author: James Joyce

name: Great Expectations
description: A novel by Charles Dickens following the life of an orphan named Pip, who grows up as a gentleman in London.
author: Charles Dickens

name: The Lord of the Rings
description: A fantasy novel by J.R.R. Tolkien following the quest to destroy the One Ring, and thus ensure the destruction of its maker, the Dark Lord Sauron.
author: J.R.R. Tolkien

name: Les Liaisons Dangereuses
description: A novel by Pierre Choderlos de Laclos following the Marquise de Merteuil and the Vicomte de Valmont, who use seduction as a weapon to humiliate and degrade others.
author: Pierre Choderlos de Laclos

name: Jane Eyre
description: A novel by Charlotte Brontë following the experiences of its eponymous heroine, including her growth to adulthood and her love for Mr. Rochester.
author: Charlotte Brontë

name: Robinson Crusoe
description: A novel by Daniel Defoe about a man shipwrecked and stranded on an uninhabited island for 28 years.
author: Daniel Defoe

name: Tess of the d'Urbervilles
description: A novel by Thomas Hardy following the tragic life of Tess Durbeyfield.
author: Thomas Hardy

name: The Sound and the Fury
description: A novel by William Faulkner following the Compson family in Mississippi from 1910 to 1928.
author: William Faulkner

name: Beloved
description: A novel by Toni Morrison about Sethe, an escaped slave who kills her own daughter to save her from a life of slavery.
author: Toni Morrison

name: David Copperfield
description: A novel by Charles Dickens following the life of David Copperfield from childhood to maturity.
author: Charles Dickens

name: Little Women
description: A novel by Louisa May Alcott following the lives of four sisters—Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy March—detailing their passage from childhood to womanhood.
author: Louisa May Alcott

name: The Call of the Wild
description: A novel by Jack London about a domesticated dog called Buck who is stolen from his home in California and sold into the brutal existence of an Alaskan sled dog.
author: Jack London

name: Gulliver's Travels
description: A novel by Jonathan Swift about Lemuel Gulliver and his voyages to strange lands where he encounters giants, tiny people, and talking horses.
author: Jonathan Swift

name: The Wind in the Willows
description: A novel by Kenneth Grahame about the adventures of four anthropomorphous animals in a pastoral version of England.
author: Kenneth Grahame

name: A Tale of Two Cities
description: A novel by Charles Dickens set in London and Paris before and during the French Revolution.
author: Charles Dickens

name: Invisible Man
description: A novel by Ralph Ellison following an African American man whose color renders him invisible, published in 1952.
author: Ralph Ellison

name: Life of Pi
description: A novel by Yann Martel following a young Indian boy named Pi who survives a shipwreck and is stranded on a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger named Richard Parker.
author: Yann Martel

name: A Clockwork Orange
description: A novel by Anthony Burgess about a dystopian future where youth gangs commit acts of ultraviolence.
author: Anthony Burgess

name: Dracula
description: A novel by Bram Stoker about Count Dracula's attempt to move from Transylvania to England so he may find new blood and spread the undead curse.
author: Bram Stoker

name: The Adventures of Sherlock Holmes
description: A collection of detective stories by Sir Arthur Conan Doyle featuring his famous detective, Sherlock Holmes, and Holmes's friend, Dr. John Watson.
author: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle

name: The Stand
description: A post-apocalyptic horror/fantasy novel by Stephen King following the spread of a lethal virus that wipes out most of the world's population.
author: Stephen King

name: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
description: A comic science fiction series by Douglas Adams following the adventures of Arthur Dent, a hapless Englishman, following the destruction of Earth by the Vogons, a race of unpleasant and bureaucratic aliens.
author: Douglas Adams

name: Atlas Shrugged
description: A novel by Ayn Rand about a dystopian United States in which private businesses suffer under increasingly burdensome laws and regulations.
author: Ayn Rand
